contextId.occurrenceNote: Moses uses a question to rebuke Eleazar and Ithamar. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. Alternate translation: "You should have eaten ... before him." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rquestion]])
contextId.glQuote: Why have you not eaten ... before him?

contextId.occurrenceNote: These sacrifices were to be eaten with joy and happiness. Aaron uses a question to emphasize that Yahweh would not be pleased for him to eat the sacrifices since he is sad because of his sons' deaths. This question may be translated as a statement. Alternate translation: "certainly, Yahweh would not have been pleased." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rquestion]])
contextId.glQuote: would it have been pleasing in the sight of Yahweh?
